intro: Hedyotis uniflora var. fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered threadleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, creeping stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance.
